tossup_question: -   –  When methyl propanoate [pro-pah-noh-ate] reacts with sodium hydroxide and the reaction is heated, sodium propanoate [pro-pah-noh-ate] and methanol form. What is the name of this type of reaction?
tossup_answer: ANSWER: SAPONIFICATION (ACCEPT: BASE HYDROLYSIS OF AN ESTER; BASIC HYDROLYSIS)
bonus_question: -   How many vibrational degrees of freedom does a molecule of ethyne have?
